intro: Nothosmyrnium japonicum var. sutchuensis, commonly known as the Sutchu variant of the Japanese nothosmyrnium, is a rare plant species native to specific regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically sensitive species.
